#Text=Canada 's Scarborough East ( Ward 44 )
#Text=city council candidates speak
#Text=Saturday , November 4 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Torontonians will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is Scarborough East ( Ward 44 ) .
#Text=One candidates responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include Donald Blair , Diana Hall , Mohammed Mirza , Ron Moeser , Kevin Richardson , Richard Rieger , Richard Ross , and Kevin Wellington .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=Diana Hall
#Text=53-year-old Diana Hall is the Executive Assistant to a City Councillor .
#Text=Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=I want to deliver a made-in-Toronto waste solution – every year Toronto residents produce 500,000 tonnes of waste .

#Text=I would like to look at implementing high-rise recycling ; investigate new technologies to convert waste into clean energy , expand our recycling program to include materials such as Styrofoam and polystyrene plastic and improve recycling to e-waste to eliminate the 140,000 tonnes of old computers , cellphones and home electronics that end up in our landfills .
#Text=I believe we should expand and integrate our public transit system as Ward 44 is poorly serviced by both the TTC and GO transit systems .

#Text=I support finding lasting solutions which include developing seamless transit that would make it easier to transfer from TTC to GO , expanding the Sheppard Subway to Scarborough and plan to push the Province to improve GO service with more trains , more often and longer hours .
#Text=I believe that the City must live within its means and we should be spending money on the core services that keep the City functioning .
#Text=I believe our priorities should be to Improve the Aging Infrastructure .
#Text=We need to make sure our water systems , electrical systems , roads and transit systems are safe and well maintained .
#Text=I will work to hold tax increases to no more than inflation and want contracts to be openly tendered so we will achieve the best value for our money .
#Text=What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=Promoting quality communities .
#Text=Ward 44 is a great place to live and we have lots of parkland , lots of green space , a new waterfront trail and community centers .
#Text=To keep it that way I will :
#Text=Promote open communication so that no planning application will go ahead without the community 's involvement .
#Text=Support the Highland Creek Community Center .
#Text=The first step towards achieving this has already been taken .
#Text=It was included in the April 2006 Capital Budget .
#Text=Make Property Standards Enforcement a Priority .
#Text=We all enjoy our well-maintained neighbourhoods .
#Text=To achieve this I will support hiring more enforcement officers for our community
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
